intro: Symplocos rayae, commonly known as the rayed wax myrtle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like India, Indonesia, and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and waxy, glossy leaves. Symplocos rayae typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical and subtropical regions.
